intro: Chilodia australis, commonly known as the Australian chilodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal regions. Chilodia australis is well adapted to dry conditions and can thrive in full sun.
